message.content: This question requires an understanding of the process of making confetti. When we make confetti, we typically cut the sheets of paper into various shapes, such as circles or squares. Therefore, the confetti differs from the original sheets of paper in terms of shape. Option (A) is incorrect because the color of the confetti can be the same as the original sheets of paper. Option (B) is incorrect because the pattern on the sheets of paper may still be visible on the confetti. Option (C) is incorrect because the temperature does not change during the process of making confetti.

Option (A) - color: When making confetti, the color of the paper may remain the same as the original sheets or it may be different. Therefore, this option is not always true and cannot be the correct answer.

Option (B) - pattern: The pattern on the original sheets of paper may or may not be present in the confetti. Confetti can be made from solid colored paper or patterned paper. So this option is not always true and cannot be the correct answer.

Option (C) - temperature: The temperature of the paper does not change when making confetti. The cutting or punching process does not involve any change in temperature. Therefore, this option is not true and cannot be the correct answer.

The original sheets of paper typically do not have these specific shapes, so the shape of the confetti differs from the original sheets. Therefore, this option is true and is the correct answer.

In conclusion, when making confetti, the shape of the confetti differs from the original sheets of paper.
